evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew occurred during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA flight on 12-25, as documented in the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early scope.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew is resistant to defeaters within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_dynamic_und_t1_early scope, as alternative causes have been ruled out.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident, including timing and dynamic conditions captured in hist_dynamic_und_t1_early.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew occurred during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA flight on 12-25, as documented in the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early scope.

assumptions: Crew communication described implies coordination issues
No mechanical faults reported in evidence
Environmental factors not indicated as primary cause
defeaters: If evidence showed clear procedural deviation without communication issues
If mechanical faults were documented causing the event
If environmental or marking deficiencies were primary causes

quotes.exact_quote: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H5 directly documents crew communication and coordination during the pushback, showing interaction and decisions that led to the aircraft moving beyond the tug release point, supporting a communication/coordination breakdown rather than procedural deviation or mechanical failure.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in distinguishing communication breakdown from procedural deviation without explicit error statements

slot_statements.availability: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early timeframe on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The environmental or marking deficiency observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during hist_dynamic_und_t1_early is robust against potential defeaters or alternative explanations.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The identified environmental or marking deficiency aligns with the key features and characteristics expected for such deficiencies in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA within the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early timeframe.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early timeframe on 12-25.

assumptions: The TRP ground markings were intended to be a stopping point and were deficient or not sufficiently visible to prevent the aircraft from passing it.
defeaters: If evidence showed the markings were adequate and visible but the crew failed to comply, this would favor procedural deviation instead.
If mechanical control failure evidence was present, it could change the interpretation.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly describes the aircraft moving beyond the marked Tug release point and hitting a barrier, indicating a marking or environmental deficiency is present and observable.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit description of marking visibility or adequacy; assumption that markings were deficient based on the aircraft passing the TRP.
